user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_io_init:
```c
void metal_io_init(struct metal_io_region *io, void *virt,
	      const metal_phys_addr_t *physmap, size_t size,
	      unsigned int page_shift, unsigned int mem_flags,
	      const struct metal_io_ops *ops)
{
	const struct metal_io_ops nops = {
		NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
	};

	io->virt = virt;
	io->physmap = physmap;
	io->size = size;
	io->page_shift = page_shift;
	if (page_shift >= sizeof(io->page_mask) * CHAR_BIT)
		/* avoid overflow */
		io->page_mask = -1UL;
	else
		io->page_mask = (1UL << page_shift) - 1UL;
	io->mem_flags = mem_flags;
	io->ops = ops ? *ops : nops;
	metal_sys_io_mem_map(io);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No function parameter variable is reassigned in this function. All assignments write to members of the object pointed to by the pointer parameter 'io' (e.g. io->virt = virt; io->physmap = physmap; io->size = size; io->page_shift = page_shift; io->page_mask = ...; io->mem_flags = mem_flags; io->ops = ops ? *ops : nops;). Modifying the object referred to by a pointer parameter is permitted by the rule; the rule prohibits changing the pointer parameter itself (e.g. io = ..., virt = ..., physmap = ..., size = ..., page_shift = ..., mem_flags = ..., ops = ...), and no such assignments occur. The temporary local 'nops' is a local object and using *ops copies the pointed-to struct without modifying the pointer parameter. The call metal_sys_io_mem_map(io) passes the pointer but does not reassign any parameter in this function. Therefore there are no fragments that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
